meanings.definition: A strong dark beer brewed in the fall.
meanings.sent1: I tried a new bock at the brewery last night.
meanings.sent2: The bock tasted rich and flavorful with hints of caramel.
meanings.sent3: The bock was so delicious, it made me want to learn how to brew my own beer.
meanings.sent4: The bock was a velvety cascade of flavors on my palate.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the bock lingered in the air, tempting me to take another sip.

meanings.sent1: The rabbit will bock over the fence to reach the juicy carrots.
meanings.sent2: I watched in amazement as the athlete bocked over the hurdles effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo challenged the bunny to a bocking competition.
meanings.sent4: Her heart bocked with excitement as she prepared to jump off the diving board.
meanings.sent5: The cat tried to bock onto the high shelf but failed miserably.

meanings.sent1: The farmer's bock was the leader of the herd.
meanings.sent2: The bock's majestic horns curved gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The bock's beard made him look wise and dignified.
meanings.sent4: The bock stood proudly on the hill, surveying his domain.
meanings.sent5: The bock's bleat echoed through the valley, signaling the start of the day.
